author: Special Correspondent
text:
North Indian communities in Erode district celebrated Holi with fanfare on Thursday.

Households in Indra Nagar and around Eashwaran Kovil street in the city where a majority of North Indians hailing from Gujarat, Rajasthan and other States have settled, wore a festive look as the celebrations were replete with singing and dancing. Elders and children alike shed inhibitions and smeared one another with coloured powder. Shops selling the coloured powder made roaring business.

The festival signifying victory of good over evil, and the arrival of spring also reflected in the preparation of delicacies such as gujiya, mathri and papri.
title: North Indians celebrate Holi with fanfare
